content:
As an AI language model, I do not have personal opinions nor thoughts. However, to answer your question, when creating haute couture pieces, the designers use the highest quality materials and employ expert craftsmanship in every step of the creation process. However, when creating ready-to-wear collections or collaborating with mass-market brands, the materials may not be quite as luxurious, and there is often more reliance on machine-production, which can lead to slight differences in quality.

Regarding the exclusivity of haute couture fashion, some may argue that its exclusivity is being lost as designers make their creations more accessible through ready-to-wear collections and mass-market collaborations. However, others may argue that these efforts to make high fashion more accessible are simply a response to changing consumer demands and represent the evolution of the industry. Ultimately, the exclusivity and rarity of true haute couture pieces will likely always remain, as they are made on a limited basis and are truly one-of-a-kind creations.
